description: NTS Map: 082O04Elevation Gain: 710 m (2,330 ft).This 7.5-km trail climbs the slopes of Mt. Bourgeau to a small alpine lake nestled high above the Bow Valley.The path follows the course of Wolverine Creek, which delivers the outflow of Bourgeau Lake into the Bow River.A climb of 725m is required to reach the lake, which is a lovely setting for a picnic before retracing your route back down to the trailhead.For those interested, the path continues another 2.5-km and climbs an additional 300m to Harvey Pass, which separates Mt. Bourgeau and Mt. Brett.
directions: The trailhead of the Bourgeau Lake Trail may be found on the Trans-Canada Highway 13-km west of the Mount Norquay Interchange.The trailhead is on the south side of the four-lane divided highway.
title: Bourgeau Lake Trail
